intro: Sida stylosa, commonly known as the silky sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Sida stylosa is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
